We'll bring clean energy to the meadow by building a watermill on the Stream
We'll introduce beavers to the Stream as a natural solution to our flooding problems
We're commited to dropping machinery emissions by re-using biofuel from our Meadow
The farm is turning into a concrete jungle! We promise to restrict development, keeping our Meadow green
Small businesses like Larry Ramsden's are suffocating under high fuel costs: we'll give them a tax break
Shale gas offers cheap energy for all of us - let's invest in the fracking industry and take advantage!
The geese barely have space to land on the farm. We'll expand our runways, meaning more deliveries for us all
If any more wind turbines go up, we won't have grass to graze. We promise to find alternative ways to power the farm!
We are committed to putting more ewes in positions of authority throughout the herd
Worried your neighbour's grass looks greener than yours? We promise to ensure good, clean grazing to everyone
The time has come to ensure everyone in the farm gets a vote - even the fieldmice and sparrows!
Our hardest working animals should get rewarded - that's why we want to increase worker's holiday allowance
Our prisoners are a blight upon our meadow! We must deport them to the South Field
A sheep has the right to defend its land. We promise the law will be on your side when facing down trespassers.
The Daily Haybail is out of control! It's time to take full control of all press to prevent fake news
The shear numbers of sheep make feed times chaotic: we'll make sure our most valuable, powerful sheep are first to trough
Our footpaths are downtrodden after years of neglect. We'll take them back into public ownership and set things right

column1: Left: High welfare & service, high tax
column3: We're as worried about the health of our lambs as you are, so we'll make sure they get more healthy hay and fewer sweet beets

column1: Right: Low welfare & service, low tax
column3: Free eweniversity for all, guaranteeing a better future for our lambs!
Junior vets have one of the toughest, most important jobs in the herd. We're dedicated to improving their working conditions
We want better connections with the Farmhouse, so we're going to build a high speed footpath between it and our Meadow
We'll set a high baa for education with more frequent and effective tests for our young lambs
Let's not be sheepish about our safety: we'll give weapons to police officers to keep our Meadow safe
We want the best healthcare for our herd - and we can only do that by privatising healthcare and fixing our broken system
We welcome all animals, from the farm and beyond, to come and enjoy and enrich our Meadow
This is no time for prairie politics: we must offer aslym to all those ducks who being forced to flee from the Pond
We will not stand for the aggression coming from the Barn, and will withhold trade until peace is restored
The conflict between the Barn and the Pond is the responsibility of us all. We must work with them to find a solution
We will build a wall across the border between our Meadow and the Paddock. And we'll get the Paddock to pay for it
The farm needs us - but we don't need the farm. We should strike out on our own and make this Meadow great again
The atrocities of chickens have gone too far. They are a threat to our herd and our farm, and we will not rest until they are destroyed!

column1: Left: high public spending, push for equality
column3: The fat are getting fatter, and we cannot allow this. We must increase taxes on the top 1% for the benefit of us all
Today we promise to provide all lambs with their own homes, once they come of age
We will finance multiple public projects to make the Meadow stronger, cleaner and fairer for everyone

The Meadow should be attractive to business, and so we promise to reduce tax rates for large business
We will build a stronger, healthier economy by selling our shearing assets and inviting more competition into the market
Our ecomomy relies on a robust financial system: so we're increasing bonuses to attract the right talent
We've herd you - so, by popular demand, we'll commission a production of "Do Alpacas Dream of Electric Sheep?"
We know the lambs love game jams, so we'll stand and demand more funding to the creative arts

column1: Right: cut to focus on business
column3: Science is the only way to better future, so we're diverting more funding to baaticle physics and cloning research
We will commit to the legalisation of medicinal and recreational weeds, which will lead to a safer, happier herd
We're tired of being fleeced by greedy executives, so we're cutting funding to the Big Bleating Corporation
Arts from the Meadow should be for the Meadow - that's why our arts fund will only benefit projects about sheep
